1.display_message: Sijian successfully invited the agents for his RFP

rfp_response.core_business_problem: The company is seeking survey software to address several internal challenges. Their primary goals are to reduce operational costs, consolidate the number of systems they use, mitigate risks associated with their current processes, and streamline their overall workflows. Essentially, they are looking for a more efficient, cost-effective, and secure way to manage their internal survey needs.

1.question: Is the system easy to use for both frequent and occasional users, by being easy to learn, intuitive to new or occasional users? Please explain

Medallia.answer: Platform is designed to be easy to use and intuitive. Our reporting includes highly configurable dashboards that are geared toward ease of use and data accessibility for all levels of your organization and can be personalized to the user. These dashboards are known for their intuititve interface, simple but instructive reports, and ability to drive engagement throughout your orgranization. In addition to reporting, our selfservice capabilities are also designed for ease of use with drag-and-drop 'what-you-see-what-you-get' interface. For the survey side, users have the option to use custom HTML or custom CSS, to control UI at pizel level and teherby achieve practivally any functionality and look and feel. In this way, you wull have complete control over UI and branding including font size and colors, foreground/background, buttons, logos, imagery,etc
Medallia.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor states that the platform is designed to be easy to use and intuitive for all user levels. They highlight configurable dashboards, a 'what-you-see-what-you-get' interface, and customization options as evidence of ease of use.

Questionpro.answer: The platform can be a DIY survey tool for those just needing a simple ad-hoc survey by just using our basic question types. We also have QxBot which is our AI tool that allows users to enter a prompt such as "write a customer feedback survey" and QxBot will generate a survey of up to 15 questions. In addition, we have numerous templates for various use cases that user can choose from and then edit to suir their situation. https://www.questionpro.com/features/qxbot.html
Questionpro.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor states that the platform can be used as a DIY tool for simple surveys and offers an AI tool (QxBot) and templates to simplify survey creation, implying ease of use for both frequent and occasional users. The provided link to QxBot is accessible and relevant, further supporting the claim of ease of use through AI-assisted survey generation.

Forsta.answer: The platform has a GUI (Graphic User Interface) that is designed to be highly intuitive and easy to master. On screen help is available and auto-defaults to open to the section most relevant to the current GUI screen view. A learning management system is also available to provide short tutorial videos on most platform functionality.
Forsta.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor states that the platform has an intuitive GUI, on-screen help, and a learning management system with tutorial videos. This directly addresses the question about ease of use for both frequent and occasional users, and ease of learning for new or occasional users.

2.question: What are your product differentiators? Please provide specific sample/screenshot/documentation

Medallia.answer: We stress the importance of usability throughout our entire offering of products. Whether this be users of reporting who are frequent or occasional, the intuitive nature of our platform allows things to make sense in a simple fashion. The same is true when it comes to those who administer surveys. Our Experience Program and Ad Hoc wizards provide easy and intuitive step by step guidance to launching surveys, associating reporting, and managing all aspects of an enterprise program at scale. see also: https://docs.medallia.com/en/medallia-experience-cloud/feedback/signal-capturing/experience-programs
Medallia.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor emphasizes usability and intuitive design as key differentiators. They provide a link to their documentation for Medallia Experience Cloud regarding Experience Programs. The linked content [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9] is accessible and relevant, describing the platform's capabilities in capturing and managing feedback, which supports their claim of ease of use and intuitive guidance for launching surveys and managing programs. The documentation details features like intuitive dashboards, signal capturing across various channels, and AI-powered analytics, which align with the vendor's description of their product differentiators. [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

Questionpro.answer: In addition to what laid our in the above response, we also have the capability for complex surveys with logic incorporated. Apart from the basic question types, we also have advanced questions for more complex analysis such as: Conjoint, maxdiff, Van Westerndorp, Gabor Granger, heat maps, and more
Questionpro.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor lists capabilities for complex surveys and advanced question types as differentiators. However, the question specifically asks for 'specific sample/screenshot/documentation', which the vendor has not provided in their response. Without this supporting evidence, the claim cannot be fully verified as meeting the question's requirements.

Forsta.answer: The platform is designed to be a powerful, yet simple to use data collection tool. It was built to be fully self service capable, with all functionality available to the user, without the need for vendor involvement. Like many of our competitors, we have grown over the years not just organically, but through the process of Mergers and Acquistion. One element that has set us apart however, is the attitude toward the influx of innovation from our Research and Development teams. Rather than simply bolt-on new pieces, or engineers to work to integrate pieces at the source level. For example, our CAPI, CATI, and Text Analytics functionality all came from acquisition, however every piece of that functionality resides completely within the platform, within the full code-frame.
Forsta.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor describes their product differentiators, focusing on ease of use, self-service capabilities, and deep integration of acquired functionalities. However, the question specifically asks for 'specific sample/screenshot/documentation', which the vendor has not provided in their text response. Therefore, the answer is incomplete based on the question's requirements.

Medallia.answer: Yes

Questionpro.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor explicitly states 'Yes', indicating the company is GDPR compliant.

Forsta.answer: Yes
Forsta.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor's response is a direct and affirmative 'Yes'.

5.question: Can the platform provide a custom domain for customer?

Medallia.answer: We enable the customization of survey URLs to allow customers to brand the URL or make it look like it is coming from the company instead of Medallia. The same applies for emails sent from the platform. All surveys will come from our Cloud service. There will be an additional cost for this service.
Medallia.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor confirms that they enable customization of survey URLs to allow customers to brand the URL, which addresses the core of providing a custom domain. They also mention this applies to emails. Although it comes with an additional cost and surveys originate from their cloud service, the capability for a custom-branded domain is present.

Questionpro.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor indicates that a custom domain can be provided, conditional on a minimum 3-year agreement. This confirms the capability exists, albeit with a condition.

Forsta.answer: Yes
Forsta.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor's response is a direct and affirmative 'Yes'.

Medallia.answer: Conducted with Admin Suite - reminders can be automated
Medallia.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor confirms that reminders can be sent and automated using the Admin Suite.

Questionpro.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor explicitly states 'Yes', indicating the platform can send reminders.

Forsta.answer: Yes, all reminders can be scheduled to be sent automatically at the required time to uncompleted or not yet started surveys
Forsta.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor's response is 'Yes' and they elaborate that reminders can be scheduled and sent automatically.

7.question: Can the platform upload background variables about participants?

Medallia.answer: Variables are a common way in which we segment. This is typically accomplished within our invitation file and can be controlled by your importer.
Medallia.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor states that uploading background variables is a common way they segment and that this is typically accomplished within the invitation file and controlled by the customer's importer. This confirms the capability.

Questionpro.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor explicitly states 'Yes', indicating the platform can upload background variables about participants.

Forsta.answer: The background variables about participants or respondants list must be in the form of a delimited text file, with the column headings in the first row. The delimiter used can be a tab, comma, or custom. This file can for example be exported from a spreadsheet application such as Excel  by using the save as function and choosing .txt.
Forsta.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor's response explains the method and format for uploading background variables (delimited text file), which implies the capability exists.

8.question: Can the platform upload email lists?

Questionpro.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor explicitly states 'Yes', indicating the platform can upload email lists.

Forsta.answer: Yes, email list must be in the form of a delimited text file, with the column headings in the first row. The delimiter used can be a tab, comma, or custom. This file can for example be exported from a spreadsheet application such as Excel  by using the save as function and choosing .txt.
Forsta.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor explicitly states 'Yes' and describes the required format for uploading email lists.

9.question: Does the platform have the option to send reminders via SMS, either to US or International destinations?

Medallia.answer: Platform has SMS capabilities that can be used for reminders as well as other use cases

Forsta.answer: Survey invitations and reminders can be sent through SMS to respondents with mobile or international phone numbers

10.question: Does the platform have an intelligent handling of invitation bounce backs so that undelivered messages are marked as uncontactable but that autoresponder such as out of the office are separated and handled appropriately?

Medallia.answer: Comprehensive secure email devliery profram managed by our internal operations group. This program is designed to ensure high compliance and exceptional response rates. Our standard process includes: robust monitoring, deliverability testing, sample disposition, list monitoring and alerting, invitee complaints, virus scans, ISPs and more.
Medallia.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor describes a comprehensive email delivery program but does not specifically address the intelligent handling of bounce backs, such as marking undelivered messages as uncontactable and differentiating autoresponders (e.g., out-of-office replies). The answer is general and doesn't confirm the specific detailed capability requested.

Questionpro.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor explicitly states 'Yes', indicating the platform has intelligent handling of invitation bounce backs.

Forsta.answer: The following statuses are logged? Badmail - server could not send the message. Queued - the email is in the sending servers outgoing queue. MessageSent - message sent successfully. ServerResponse - transient status between queued and other statuses.
Forsta.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor's answer lists several logged statuses for email delivery, including 'Badmail'. However, it does not explicitly state that undelivered messages are marked as 'uncontactable', nor does it mention if or how autoresponders (like 'out of the office' messages) are specifically separated and handled appropriately, which is a key part of the question regarding 'intelligent handling'.

These are full integrations that allow for a seamless process for the panelist.

19.question: Does the platform allow data export in real time?

25.question: Does the System offer high levels of resilience in the event of a server or database failure? Does it include capabilities for server clustering, server and data storage redundancy and database replication? Please explain.

Medallia.answer: Scalable architecture ensures our clients always have access to their customer feedback. We use Docker Containers orchestrared with Kubernetes which allow instant relocatability. We are rack-fault tollerant and run our services in High Availability mode across multiple racks. Container services are both horizontally and vertically scalable. CheckMarket SaaS is hosted at multiple data centers using redundant hardware, and load balancing to deliver unmatched up-time and perfromance. All data is synchronized between our data centers in real time, with multiple copies stored on multiple machines.
Medallia.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor provides a detailed explanation of their architecture, including the use of Docker Containers orchestrated with Kubernetes, rack-fault tolerance, High Availability mode across multiple racks, horizontal and vertical scalability of container services, hosting at multiple data centers with redundant hardware, load balancing, and real-time data synchronization with multiple copies. This comprehensively addresses the requirements for high resilience, server clustering, server and data storage redundancy, and database replication.

Questionpro.answer: Yes refer to the attached PDF policy
Questionpro.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor's answer "Yes refer to the attached PDF policy" claims the capability but relies on an external attachment ("PDF policy") that was not provided for analysis. Therefore, the capabilities for server clustering, server and data storage redundancy, and database replication, and the explanation for resilience cannot be verified. The answer is unverifiable without the attachment.

Forsta.answer: We monitor usage and performance 24x7. The architecture of the platform where servers are load balanced across multiple servers, provides capabolity to add additional servers as the number of users increases and demand for resources increases. Historical platform performance details area availble as requested. All critical systems in the datacenter are N+1 resillient to provide uniterrupted availability. All data center systems are tested regurarly. Weekly tests are also conducted on all HVAC, UPS, Fire supression, and generator systems.
Forsta.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor's response describes measures for general resilience, such as 24x7 monitoring, load-balanced servers (implying server clustering and server redundancy), and N+1 resilience for critical systems. However, the question specifically asks if the system includes capabilities for 'server clustering, server and data storage redundancy and database replication'. While server clustering and server redundancy are addressed or strongly implied, the response does not explicitly mention 'database replication' or provide specific details on 'data storage redundancy' beyond the general 'N+1 resilient critical systems'. Since a specific capability listed in the question ('database replication') is not explicitly confirmed, the answer is considered incomplete for fully meeting all stated conditions.

26.question: Does your product fully align to MVSP controls?

Medallia.answer: We follow ISO27001 framework and align with the security checklist in MVSP contols
Medallia.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor states they 'align with the security checklist in MVSP contols.' This phrasing does not explicitly confirm 'full alignment' with all MVSP (Minimum Viable Secure Product) controls as requested by the question. Aligning with a checklist is a positive step but is not a definitive statement of full adherence to the entire MVSP framework, which may encompass more than just a checklist. The answer is not a clear 'Yes' to full alignment, making the confirmation incomplete.

Questionpro.answer: Securtiy overview attached as PDF Policy
Questionpro.reasoning_behind_result: The vendor did not provide a direct affirmative or negative answer (e.g., "Yes" or "No") to whether the product fully aligns with MVSP controls. Instead, the response "Securtiy overview attached as PDF Policy" refers to an attachment that was not provided for analysis. Therefore, alignment with MVSP controls cannot be verified. The answer is incomplete and unverifiable without the attachment.

Forsta.answer: We follow SOC2 Type industry standards. At an organizational level we also adhere to HITRUST.
Forsta.reasoning_behind_result: The question asks for confirmation of full alignment with MVSP (Minimum Viable Secure Product) controls. The vendor states that they follow SOC2 Type industry standards and adhere to HITRUST at an organizational level. While SOC2 and HITRUST are recognized security frameworks, they are distinct from MVSP. The vendor's response does not directly confirm or provide evidence of full alignment with MVSP controls specifically. Therefore, the requirement as stated in the question is not confirmed as met.

primary_business_objectives: Implement an intuitive and accessible survey platform that is easy to use for both frequent and occasional users, and compliant with WCAG 2.0 AA / Section 508 standards.
Ensure robust data security, system resilience (including server/database failure recovery), and compliance with regulations like GDPR and MVSP controls.

Streamline survey operations through efficient questionnaire design, sample/recruiting management (including email/SMS reminders, bounce handling), and panel management (including incentives and data import/export).
Enable seamless data integration and management, including API access for survey creation/customization, real-time data export, and compatibility with various data formats (CSV, Excel, SPSS).
Facilitate smooth migration of existing survey projects and raw data from incumbent systems to the new platform.
Obtain clear and fixed pricing for ongoing managed services, including dedicated support.
Allow for platform customization, such as the use of a custom domain for branding.

Functional Requirements.reasoning: This category has the highest number of questions (18) and covers the core capabilities essential for the survey software to be fit for purpose. Questions address fundamental aspects like ease of use, compliance (GDPR, WCAG), core survey operations (reminders, data uploads, panel management, questionnaire design), and API integration. These are critical for daily operations, meeting legal requirements, and achieving the goal of 'Streamline processes'. Without strong functional capabilities, the other aspects are less relevant.

Services Requirements.reasoning: This category includes 6 questions crucial for the practical implementation, integration, and ongoing management of the survey platform. Key areas include data export capabilities (real-time, various formats), metadata exposure, migration support from incumbent systems, and managed services (like a dedicated TAM). These elements are vital for ensuring a smooth transition, effective data utilization, and achieving the goals of 'Reduce Systems' and 'Streamline processes' through good support and integration.

Technical Requirements.reasoning: Although this category has only two questions, they are of paramount importance, focusing on system resilience, data security (including MVSP alignment), and database integrity. These directly address the RFP objective to 'Reduce Risk'. For a system handling 34 million annual completes and 1000+ users globally, robust technical foundations are non-negotiable to ensure reliability, prevent data loss, and protect sensitive information.

Medallia.tco_reasoning: The total sum of costs is calculated by aggregating the annual figures from the 'Total' line item in the provided pricing data. This involves summing the 'Year 1 Total' (4,110,000 USD), 'Year 2 Total' (4,110,000 USD), and 'Year 3 Total' (4,110,000 USD), all corresponding to the line item with the description 'Total'. The resulting aggregate financial commitment for the three-year period is 12,330,000 USD.

Questionpro.tco_reasoning: The aggregate financial commitment was calculated by combining the costs detailed in the pricing table with an additional quoted service. The pricing table specifies 'Enterprise Research' costs (Year 1: 1,485,000 USD, Year 2: 1,650,000 USD, Year 3: 1,749,000 USD) and 'Support Services' costs (Year 1: 10,000 USD, Year 2: 12,000 USD, Year 3: 15,000 USD). The sum of these itemized table costs is 1,495,000 USD for Year 1, 1,662,000 USD for Year 2, and 1,764,000 USD for Year 3, aligning with the 'Total Cost' line item in the table, summing to 4,921,000 USD over three years. Additionally, a cost for 'ongoing managed services (ie dedicated TAM and detailed scope)' was provided in the RFP question responses (Question 24) at 4,200 USD/month (equating to 50,400 USD/year). Assuming this managed service is supplementary to the services itemized in the pricing table, its three-year cost of 151,200 USD is added. The total sum of costs is therefore 4,921,000 USD (from table totals) + 151,200 USD (for additional managed services), resulting in 5,072,200 USD.

Forsta.tco_reasoning: The aggregate financial commitment is derived by summing the annual costs presented in the 'Total' line item (row 3 of the pricing data). Specifically, this includes the 'Year 1 Total' of 1,750,000 USD, the 'Year 2 Total' of 1,750,000 USD, and the 'Year 3 Total' of 1,750,000 USD, culminating in an overall projected expenditure of 5,250,000.

reasoning_behind_analysis.analysis_reasoning: The vendor's response was evaluated for a direct and unambiguous affirmation (e.g., 'Yes') or denial of the capability. Vague, evasive, or indirect answers were generally insufficient for a positive result.
The answer was checked to ensure it addressed all components and sub-questions within the main question. Omission of any part often led to a 'False' result or was noted as incomplete.
General statements were often deemed insufficient. The analysis looked for specific details in the vendor's response that elaborated on how the platform meets the questioned capability.

If the question requested supporting materials (e.g., documentation, screenshots, samples) or if the vendor provided them (e.g., URLs), their provision, accessibility, and relevance in substantiating the claim were key factors in the analysis.

Claims, especially those supported by external references like URLs, were assessed for verifiability. If a link was non-functional, led to irrelevant content, or did not support the specific claim, the capability was considered unverified.

reasoning_behind_analysis.parameter_for_evaluation: Standard Platform Capability vs. Add-on/Custom Work
reasoning_behind_analysis.analysis_reasoning: The analysis distinguished between features that are inherent, out-of-the-box parts of the platform versus those requiring custom solutioning, separate paid services, or functionalities provided by a distinct, non-integrated partner product.

reasoning_behind_analysis.parameter_for_evaluation: Adherence to Question's Specific Terminology and Scope
reasoning_behind_analysis.analysis_reasoning: The vendor's answer was evaluated on its precise alignment with the specific terms, standards, or scope defined in the question (e.g., 'fixed pricing structure,' 'full MVSP alignment,' specific aspects of a feature).

If an answer relied on information contained in an attachment (e.g., 'see attached PDF/proposal'), and that attachment was not provided or accessible within the input, the claim could not be verified.
In some cases, if a capability was not explicitly stated with a 'Yes' but the provided details strongly and directly implied its existence and functionality, it could be considered confirmed.
Responses that were clearly incomplete (e.g., ending abruptly), self-referential without providing new information, or internally contradictory were deemed insufficient to confirm a capability.

ai_recommaned_vendor.reasoning_for_recommendation: Medallia is recommended as it was the only vendor to meet all identified critical requirements, which is the foremost consideration in this evaluation. This ensures fundamental alignment with essential operational and product needs. Furthermore, Medallia demonstrated the strongest overall performance when requirements are weighted by their strategic importance, reflecting solid capabilities across functional, services, and particularly technical areas, which is another key evaluation aspect. While its vendor price is notably higher compared to other bidders, the successful fulfillment of critical requirements, coupled with its superior weighted performance, provides a foundational assurance that is prioritized in this decision.

why_not_others.non_recommended_vendor_reason: Questionpro was not selected primarily because it did not meet all critical requirements, a key evaluation threshold. While it offered the most competitive vendor price and demonstrated the highest percentage of overall requirements met (unweighted), its failure to satisfy critical needs and a weaker performance in heavily weighted technical areas (contributing to a lower overall weighted score than the top candidate) made it a less favorable option.

Forsta was not chosen due to its inability to meet all critical requirements, which is the highest priority evaluation factor. Additionally, it met a lower percentage of overall requirements, showed the weakest performance when requirements were weighted by strategic importance (particularly in technical areas), and its vendor price was less competitive than other alternatives. Consequently, it presented the least compelling overall value proposition among the bidders.

rfp_response.pricing_analysis: Medallia's vendor price is considerably elevated compared to other submissions and is substantially above the defined budgetary limits. This premium vendor price requires a thorough financial assessment, balanced against their leading performance in fulfilling critical needs and overall strategic alignment.
reasoning_and_comparative_advantages: Uniquely fulfilled all critical requirements, the foremost evaluation priority, ensuring all essential operational and product mandates are met.
Achieved the highest overall weighted score, indicating the strongest alignment with strategic priorities and superior capability in key areas, including crucial technical and security aspects.
risk_analysis: The proposed vendor price is significantly higher than other bidders and substantially exceeds the allocated budget, necessitating careful financial justification.
Demonstrated moderately lower coverage of overall requirements on an unweighted basis compared to an alternative, though performance against top-priority criteria was superior.
As a non-incumbent supplier, onboarding and integration will require dedicated effort, typical for establishing new vendor partnerships.
